name: Goliath: The Game of the Demons
overview: Behind the weighty name hides more of a David of the tinkering genre: Two players (a weak computer opponent can step in if desired) try to put together randomly given figures on a 16 x 16 field board to form rectangles. Practically and in terms of rules, this amounts to something like a mixture of "Tetris" and "Reversi". The story is spiced up a little by two additional game modes with bonus stones or other game field limitations, a help function and various character sets Despite the stone-typical compulsion to repeat, also known as the addictive effect.
